segments.text: For our lunch meeting with the investors , do we have to make a reservation at the restaurant or do we just show up ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Usually for lunch , we don't have to reserve a table , they should allow walk-ins . But to be on the safe side , I'll order a table for half-past twelve . Will that suit your schedule ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I've arranged to meet them at the restaurant at twelve . Can you make the reservation a little earlier ? If we start earlier , it will give us more time for a longer lunch .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Are you planning on treating the investors to a full-course meal ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , we'll start with appetizers , follow with a soup and salad course , then main dishes of prime rib or cordon bleu chicken , and finish up with a delicious rich dessert of some sort .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That'll be pretty heavy for a mid-day meal , don't you think ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: As along as we stay away from anything alcoholic , we should be okay .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: With your prime rib and chicken choices , you'd better hope nobody's vegetarian .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We can make some special arrangement if we need to . After all , it's the company who is footing the bill .
segments.speaker: S1
